docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.text: Your Caption Here

docs.text: Reference to RESTful API in Prod Environment

docs.title: Syslog Service Detailed Design for XYZ Corp
Overview
docs.text: Designed to offer a centralized Syslog service tailored for XYZ Corp's multi-state operations. The architecture provides custom configurations for three distinct environments: Production (Prod), Testing (Test), and Development (Dev).

docs.title: Option 1
docs.text: TEST

docs.title: Direct Syslog Feed (Port 514 UDP/TCP)
docs.text:
• Architecture
  • Dual primary syslog servers for high availability

  • ElasticSearch cluster for data storage

  • Security

  • Log data encrypted at rest

  • Access Control through Windows AD

  • Retention and Backup

  • Log retention: 90 days
  • Off-site backup every 24 hours
Parameter Value Syslog Servers 2 Data Storage ElasticSearch Cluster Log Retention 90 days Backup Frequency Off-site every 24 hours

docs.title: Test Environment
docs.text:
• Architecture
  • Single primary syslog server

  • ElasticSearch for data storage

  • Security

  • Access Control through Windows AD

  • Retention and Backup

  • Log retention: 30 days
  • No off-site backup
Parameter Value Syslog Server 1 Data Storage ElasticSearch Log Retention 30 days Backup Frequency None

docs.title: Dev Environment
docs.text:
• Architecture
  • Single primary syslog server

  • ElasticSearch for data storage

  • Security

  • Rate-limiting on API

  • Retention and Backup

  • Log retention: 7 days
  • No backup
Parameter Value Syslog Server 1 Data Storage ElasticSearch Log Retention 7 days Backup Frequency None

docs.title: Prod Environment
docs.text:
• Auth
  • API keys or OAuth2 tokens

docs.title: Test Environment
docs.text:
• Auth
  • API keys

docs.title: Dev Environment
docs.text:
• Auth
  • OAuth2 tokens

docs.title: Detailed Design for Component2 of SystemB
1. Table of Contents
docs.text:
• 1. Table of Contents
  • 2. Functional Requirements
  • 2.1. Introduction
  • 2.2. Contents
  • 2.3. Navigating the Requirements
  • 2.4. Updates and Contributions

docs.title: 2. Functional Requirements
docs.text: Welcome to the functional requirements section of our documentation. Here, we outline the necessary actions, processes, and needs the system should be able to perform.

docs.title: 2.1. Introduction
docs.text: Functional requirements define what the system should do. They describe the features and functionalities of the software/system in clear and concise terms. They form the basis for any application and ensure that the final product aligns with the needs of the user.

docs.title: 2.2. Contents
docs.text:
• Requirement 1 - Brief description of Requirement 1
  • Requirement 2 - Brief description of Requirement 2
  • ... (and so on for each requirement)

docs.title: 2.3. Navigating the Requirements
docs.text: Each requirement page provides a detailed overview, context, any associated diagrams or flowcharts, and how it fits into the overall system architecture.

docs.title: Syslog Service Detailed Design for XYZ Corp
Overview
docs.text: Designed to offer a centralized Syslog service tailored for XYZ Corp's multi-state operations. The architecture provides custom configurations for three distinct environments: Production (Prod), Testing (Test), and Development (Dev).

docs.title: Option 1
docs.text: TEST

docs.title: Direct Syslog Feed (Port 514 UDP/TCP)
docs.text:

  • Log retention: 90 days
  • Off-site backup every 24 hours
